title: How to Make Brazilian Lemonade

steps.headline: Remove any seeds and the covering from the limes.
Put the limes into a blender.
Add in sugar-water solution to the desired sweetness.
Pass the liquid blend through a strainer while collecting the strained liquid in a bowl.
Pour in some condensed milk to the liquid in bowl and stir.
The Brazilian Lemonade is ready!
steps.description: Serve chilled in glasses. You can add ice cubes to enhance the chill.

text:
Pour the water into a pitcher or any other suitable container. Mix the sugar with water. Place it into the fridge to allow it to cool. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/9\/96\/Make-Brazilian-Lemonade-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-Brazilian-Lemonade-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/9\/96\/Make-Brazilian-Lemonade-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/aid2676820-v4-728px-Make-Brazilian-Lemonade-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Wash and rinse the limes. Cut the limes into one-eighths. Remove any seeds and the covering from the limes. Put the limes into a blender. Add in sugar-water solution to the desired sweetness. Blend 5 to 6 times. Pass the liquid blend through a strainer while collecting the strained liquid in a bowl. Pour in some condensed milk to the liquid in bowl and stir. The Brazilian Lemonade is ready! Serve chilled in glasses. You can add ice cubes to enhance the chill.
